ReportSection.name: Introduction
ReportSection.ReportItem:
The GARS system collects information required by the Occupational Therapy (OT) Department graduate-review process.

Please note:
  • You only have to provide this information once, even if you are applying to multiple graduate OT programs.
  • You must provide to GARS your GSMS ID, so that we can cross-reference the information in GARS with the information in GSMS.
  • If you have any questions regarding the GARS system, or any concerns regarding your GARS data, please contact support@gars.ualberta.ca.
  • If you have any questions about the appliation process (FGSR/GSMS) please contact mscot.info@ualberta.ca

ReportSection.name: Applicant ID
ReportSection.title: Applicant ID
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Applicant ID

Please enter your 8-digit Admissions Number (beginning with '16' or '17') from your FGSR application. After you have submitted an FGSR application, you can login to your Applicant portal, and you will see your application. When you click on 'Show Details' it will display your 8-digit Admissions Number (GSMS ID).

Note: You need to submit your GSMS/FGSR application in order to receive your ID. You will be able to continue uploading documents to GSMS/FGSR after submitting.

{$item}
An ID must be provided
The ID entered is not in the format 16XXXXXX

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Personal information on this form is collected under the authority of Section 33(c) of Alberta’s Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act and will be protected under Part 2 of that Act. It will be used for authorized purposes including admission and registration; administration of records, scholarships and awards, student services; and university planning and research. Students’ personal information may be used by academic and administrative units according to university policy, and operational needs. It is disclosed pursuant to federal and provincial regulatory reporting requirements, data sharing agreements with student governance associations, and to contracted or public health care providers as required. Direct any questions about this collection to the Admissions Services Supervisor, Faculty of Graduate Studies and Research, Killam Centre for Advanced Studies, 2-29 Triffo Hall, University of Alberta, Edmonton, AB T6G 2E1, 780-492-3499 or visit the Information and Privacy Office website.

You must agree to the following declaration before submitting your application:

  • I agree, if admitted to the University of Alberta, to comply with University regulations.
  • I certify that the information in this application is true and complete in all respects and that I have withheld no information.
  • I authorize the University to verify any information provided as part of this application.
  • I understand that misrepresentation, falsification of documents, or withholding of requested information regarding this application are serious offences and may result in prosecution under the University's Code of Applicant Behaviour, Code of Student Behaviour and/or the Criminal Code of Canada.
  • I attest that I have completed all questions to the best of my ability and without the assistance of other individuals.
{$item}

ReportSection.name: Submit

ReportItem.text: By clicking the SUBMIT button above, a PDF document with your OT GARS data will be generated. At this point, you will no longer be able to edit your OT GARS data. Please review the correctness of the information you have provided through the Review step. To complete the Letter of Intent all applicants must upload a copy of their PDF in to the Department Check section of the online application. Applications missing the PDF letter of intent will be considered incomplete and not reviewed. As with all supporting documents the Letter of Intent PDF must be uploaded by the application deadline of January 31st, 11:59 p.m. (MST)

ReportSection.ReportItem: You need to accept the declaration before you complete the application.
